item.title: Why Is Frida Kahlo's Auction Record So Low?
item.description:
Why Is Frida Kahlo's Auction Record So Low?

Over dinner a few days ago, I mentioned to my roommate that Frida Kahlo's auction record had recently been broken-her 1939 painting Dos Desnudos en el Bosque (La Tierra Misma) sold for $8 million at Christie's New York's spring Impressionist and modern evening sale two weeks earlier.

item.title: Reading Between the Lines of Mel Bochner's Verbose Monoprints
item.description:
Reading Between the Lines of Mel Bochner's Verbose Monoprints

One of the words that the artist worked with for these monoprints is "money." It kicks off a cascade of synonyms and slang, appearing at the upper left corner of a work titled (appropriately) Money (2015).

item.title: NYC’s PDN PhotoPlus Expo
item.description:
NYC’s PDN PhotoPlus Expo

NYC’s PDN PhotoPlus Expo Rocks. Keynote speaker Graham Nash sets the stage.

New York, NY – November 2016 / Renay Elle Morris / photopresseimages.com

item.title: Adrian Ghenie
item.description:
Adrian Ghenie

Born 1977 in Baia Mare, Romania. Lives and works in Cluj and Berlin.

item.title: Peter Pincus, 'Urn', 2015, Wexler Gallery | Artsy
item.description: Challenging the traditional categories of art, Wexler Gallery exhibits work that coexists in the expressive realms of design and fine art. Questioning the boundaries of these fields, the gallery presents functional work that celebrates innovation as much as aesthetic beauty.

item.title: Richard Tinkler, 'untitled #45', 2016, Albert Merola Gallery
item.description:
Richard Tinkler, 'untitled #45', 2016, Albert Merola Gallery

Home Museums Artists Fairs Shows Auctions Galleries Magazine

item.title: Kendell Geers, 'Wretched of the Earth 48', 2014-2016, ADN | Artsy
item.description: Incorporating language, ready-mades, broken glass, film, performance, and other elements, Kendell Geers creates work that disrupts social norms and codes. Employing a wide range of references-from art history to pornography, iconography to kitsch-Geers questions the value of aesthetics and thumbs his nose at the concept of originality.

item.title: Agustina Woodgate, '$8.05 (Ink on paper diptych )', 2016, Spinello Projects | Artsy
item.description:
Agustina Woodgate, '$8.05 (Ink on paper diptych )', 2016, Spinello Projects | Artsy

Agustina Woodgate creates art across multiple disciplines, her primary focus being the interplay between human beings and their surroundings. Born in Buenos Aires, Woodgate moved to Miami in 2004, where she gained recognition for covertly stitching labels inscribed with poems into thrift-store clothing ("poetry bombing,") and for her work made with human hair.

item.title: Julia Fox, '3', 2016, InLiquid | Artsy
item.description:
Julia Fox, '3', 2016, InLiquid | Artsy

InLiquid is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization committed to the promotion, advancement, and exhibition of artists in the Philadelphia region and beyond. InLiquid organizes numerous community-based events and exhibitions each year, and provides extensive art resources online.

item.title: Rafik Majzoub, 'Room 11 - 2', 2015, Art On 56th | Artsy
item.description:
Rafik Majzoub, 'Room 11 - 2', 2015, Art On 56th | Artsy

Art on 56th Gallery is an independent visual art gallery in Beirut, Lebanon. In addition to presenting a roster of Middle Eastern and international artists, the gallery's mission is to promote both established and promising contemporary Lebanese artists.
